ai.summary: A hard, long-distance day hike covering 31.4 km in the UK. The route demands fitness, map reading, and steady pacing, with varied terrain and potential weather changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect varied UK terrain: forest tracks, gravel paths, exposed ridges, and sections that can be boggy or uneven. Navigation and solid footing are important, and gradients may be challenging in places.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for rapidly changing UK weather; carry full waterproofs and extra layers; use map and compass (and GPS as backup); stay on the route and note bail-out points; start early to maximize daylight; carry sufficient water and high-energy food; let someone know your plan and expected return; carry a whistle and a compact first-aid kit; keep a charged mobile phone as a backup and be prepared for limited reception; consider emergency shelter for unexpected delays; turn back if weather worsens or fatigue becomes a safety risk.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (base layer, mid-layer, outer shell)
Map and compass (and GPS as backup)
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
Mobile phone with offline maps and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are best for Gordon Way; winter hiking is more demanding and requires advanced skills and equipment.

seo.title: Gordon Way (31.4 km) – Hard UK Hike Guide
seo.meta_description: Discover Gordon Way, a challenging 31.4 km hike in the UK. This guide covers terrain, safety tips, gear, and best seasons for tackling this hard route.
seo.h1: Gordon Way: 31.4 km Hard Hike in the UK
